Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Baader Meinhof Complex" to the user.
" The Baader Meinhof Complex" is a 2008 American spy thriller film directed by Barry Levinson and written by Eric Van Dielen based on the novel of the same name by Alex Paulides.
In the movie, the main character Robert Langdon (played by Tom Hanks) works as a symbologist for Harvard University. When his wife, Emily Stemple (played by Ellen Burstyn)), divorces him, he becomes bitter and is prevented from seeing his child.
When a wealthy businessman named Max von Winterhalen (played by Armin Mueller-Stahl)) takes his daughter to court in order to see his child, Robert Langdon is assigned to help track down "The Tooth Fairy", a mysterious serial killer who is known for stealing children's teeth.
As he works with the nuclear physicist Dr. Henry Landry (played by Thure Lindhardt)), Robert Langdon begins to realize that there may be more to "The Tooth Fairy" than just his theft of children's teeth.
As he continues to work with Dr. Henry Landry, Robert Langdon becomes increasingly fascinated by the mysterious serial killer "The Tooth Fairy".
